verses.name: John 2:1
verses.text: And the third day there was a marriage in Cana of Galilee; and the mother of Jesus was there:

verses.name: John 2:2
verses.text: And both Jesus was called, and his disciples, to the marriage.

verses.name: John 2:3
verses.text: And when they wanted wine, the mother of Jesus saith unto him, They have no wine.

verses.name: John 2:4
verses.text: Jesus saith unto her, Woman, what have I to do with thee? mine hour is not yet come.

verses.name: John 2:5
verses.text: His mother saith unto the servants, Whatsoever he saith unto you, do it.

verses.name: John 2:6
verses.text: And there were set there six waterpots of stone, after the manner of the purifying of the Jews, containing two or three firkins apiece.

verses.name: John 2:7
verses.text: Jesus saith unto them, Fill the waterpots with water. And they filled them up to the brim.

verses.name: John 2:8
verses.text: And he saith unto them, Draw out now, and bear unto the governor of the feast. And they bare it.

verses.name: John 2:9
verses.text: When the ruler of the feast had tasted the water that was made wine, and knew not whence it was: (but the servants which drew the water knew;) the governor of the feast called the bridegroom,

verses.name: John 2:10
verses.text: And saith unto him, Every man at the beginning doth set forth good wine; and when men have well drunk, then that which is worse: but thou hast kept the good wine until now.

verses.name: John 2:11
verses.text: This beginning of miracles did Jesus in Cana of Galilee, and manifested forth his glory; and his disciples believed on him.

verses.name: John 2:12
verses.text: After this he went down to Capernaum, he, and his mother, and his brethren, and his disciples: and they continued there not many days.

verses.name: John 2:13
verses.text: And the Jews’ passover was at hand, and Jesus went up to Jerusalem,

verses.name: John 2:14
verses.text: And found in the temple those that sold oxen and sheep and doves, and the changers of money sitting:

verses.name: John 2:15
verses.text: And when he had made a scourge of small cords, he drove them all out of the temple, and the sheep, and the oxen; and poured out the changers’ money, and overthrew the tables;

verses.name: John 2:16
verses.text: And said unto them that sold doves, Take these things hence; make not my Father’s house an house of merchandise.

verses.name: John 2:17
verses.text: And his disciples remembered that it was written, The zeal of thine house hath eaten me up.

verses.name: John 2:18
verses.text: Then answered the Jews and said unto him, What sign shewest thou unto us, seeing that thou doest these things?

verses.name: John 2:19
verses.text: Jesus answered and said unto them, Destroy this temple, and in three days I will raise it up.

verses.name: John 2:20
verses.text: Then said the Jews, Forty and six years was this temple in building, and wilt thou rear it up in three days?

verses.name: John 2:21
verses.text: But he spake of the temple of his body.

verses.name: John 2:22
verses.text: When therefore he was risen from the dead, his disciples remembered that he had said this unto them; and they believed the scripture, and the word which Jesus had said.

verses.name: John 2:23
verses.text: Now when he was in Jerusalem at the passover, in the feast day, many believed in his name, when they saw the miracles which he did.

verses.name: John 2:24
verses.text: But Jesus did not commit himself unto them, because he knew all men,

verses.name: John 2:25
verses.text: And needed not that any should testify of man: for he knew what was in man.
